p: The order Mononegavirales are non-segmented and negative-sense single stranded RNA viruses encoding 5â€“10 ORFs. Sequences of two mononegaviruses were detected in Anopheles spp. in Liberia, Senegal, and Burkina Faso [ 32]. The two viruses, Bolahun virus (BOAV) and Gambiae virus (GAMV), have similar genome organization with six non-overlapping ORFs.
